@description.name: @description
@description.body:
All of the resizing information about a column.

This is used internally by qx.ui.table and qx.ui.progressive's table and
may be used for other widgets as well.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
left {Integer} Any integer value for the left position,
always in pixels
@param.description:
Any integer value for the left position,
always in pixels

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
top {Integer} Any integer value for the top position,
always in pixels
@param.description:
Any integer value for the top position,
always in pixels

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
width {Integer} Any positive integer value for the width,
always in pixels
@param.description:
Any positive integer value for the width,
always in pixels

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
height {Integer} Any positive integer value for the height,
always in pixels
@param.description:
Any positive integer value for the height,
always in pixels

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map} A map of which layout sizes changed.
@return.desc: A map of which layout sizes changed.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the computed width of the column.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Set the column width. The column width can be one of the following values: * Pixels: e.g. 23 * Autosized: "auto" * Flex: e.g. "1*" * Percent: e.g. "33%"

@param.name: @param
@param.body: flex {Integer?0} Optional flex value of the column
@param.description: Optional flex value of the column
